column3:
> "We should generally avoid writing to debug.log unconditionally"

Yes please. Loose logging practices just cause scared users.

Concept ACK.

After discussion on IRC I removed the weird branching on fInbound to decide between LogPrint and LogPrintf...added a new "New outbound peer connected" log to ::VERACK handling to replace it. Also added a general comment in util.h about LogPrint/LogPrintf usage.

What about the debug.log message `"connection from <Peer> dropped (banned)"`?\nI banned the nodes in gmaxwells banlist.cli.txt, and some of them aggressively try to connect permanently every few seconds after being banned, e.g. this one (this is a original cutout of the debug.log, the messages are exactly like this (except the x-anonymization), I did not remove other log entries in between)\n```
Added the banned listing to the list as well (thanks!)...I'm sure there's others that are missed that can be triggered in validation logic, but I'll leave those for a future PR.

Would prefer to create a BCLog::ALWAYS category and use something like `pfrom->fInbound ? BCLog::NET: BCLog::ALWAYS` instead of repeating the log statements in this way.\n(after that you could even factor it to a uint32_t log_category = ...` at the beginning of the function ProcessMessage)
